metadata.Title: CVE-2019-20429 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - low.
metadata.Description:
In the Lustre file system before 2.12.3, the ptlrpc module has an out-of-bounds read and panic (via a modified lm_bufcount field) due to the lack of validation for specific fields of packets sent by a client. This is caused by interaction between sptlrpc_svc_unwrap_request and lustre_msg_hdr_size_v2.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-20429` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-1002-gke - 5.15.0-1002.2
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-1002-ibm - 5.15.0-1002.2
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-1004-intel-iotg - 5.15.0-1004.6
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-22-lowlatency - 5.15.0-22.22
linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-22-lowlatency-64k - 5.15.0-22.22
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.17.0-1003-oem - 5.17.0-1003.3
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.0.0-1006-oem - 6.0.0-1006.6
No subscription required

linux-image-5.13.0-1008-raspi - 5.13.0-1008.9
linux-image-5.13.0-1008-raspi-nolpae - 5.13.0-1008.9
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-1002-gke - 5.15.0-1002.2
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-1002-ibm - 5.15.0-1002.2
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-1004-intel-iotg - 5.15.0-1004.6
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-22-lowlatency - 5.15.0-22.22
linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-22-lowlatency-64k - 5.15.0-22.22
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.17.0-1003-oem - 5.17.0-1003.3
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.0.0-1006-oem - 6.0.0-1006.6
No subscription required

notes.Note: sbeattie> lustre was removed from the upstream staging tree in 4.18 (be65f9ed267fd7d8b3146b7c4be9ecdd3e0aa3ed)
